intro: Boechera subpinnatifida, commonly known as the Sierra wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, pinnately lobed leaves and clusters of small, yellow flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open, sunny habitats. Boechera subpinnatifida is adapted to arid environments and is often found in mountainous regions.
